casebody.data:
Cuyahoga County Bar Association v. Stidham.

[Cite as Cuyahoga Cty. Bar Assn. v. Stidham (1994), 69 Ohio St.3d 80.]

(No. 93-2175 Submitted February 22, 1994 Decided April 27, 1994.) *82Michael E. Murman and Laurence A. Turbow, for relator. Richard J. Stidham, pro se. Per Curiam.

We concur in the findings and recommendation of the board. Respondent is hereby suspended from the practice of law for two years; after one year, respondent, upon application, will be reinstated and placed on probation for the second year with supervision by the Cuyahoga County Bar Association to *83identify and prevent recurring patterns of neglect, failure to account, and failure to properly maintain and deliver clients’ funds. Costs taxed to respondent.

Judgment accordingly.

Moyer, C.J., AW. Sweeney, Douglas, Wright, Resnick, F.E. Sweeney and Pfeifer, JJ., concur.
